api.technique.variationpoints.aggregation.aggregation_method module¶

TODO

class api.technique.variationpoints.aggregation.aggregation_method.AggregationMethod(value)¶

Bases: enum.Enum

The methods in which a series of numbers is combined into one.

There are two scenarios in which this step is necessary: 1. Aggregating transitive relation scores between a source and target artifacts into a single score 2. Aggregation two (or more) techniques into a single technique represented as a similarity matrix.

MAX = 'MAX'¶
PCA = 'PCA'¶
SUM = 'SUM'¶

api.technique.variationpoints.aggregation.pca_aggregation.aggregate_pca(x_test) → numpy.ndarray¶

Returns the predictions on x_test after training on x_train and y_train.

api.technique.variationpoints.aggregation.pca_aggregation.get_weights(matrix)¶

Given a matrix containing artifact combinations as rows and techniques as CACHE_COLUMNS, Returns the weight of each technique.

api.technique.variationpoints.aggregation.technique_aggregation_calculator.aggregate_techniques(technique_similarity_matrices: [typing.Union[scipy.sparse.csr_matrix, numpy.ndarray]], aggregation_method: api.technique.variationpoints.aggregation.aggregation_method.AggregationMethod) → Union[scipy.sparse.csr_matrix, numpy.ndarray]¶

Performs an element-wise aggregation on similarity technique_matrices (representing techniques) with given method :param technique_similarity_matrices: all the similarity technique_matrices assumed to be of same shape :param aggregation_method: the element-wise operations :return: similarity matrix of the same shape all the ones given after being aggregated
